docstr: `EXIT` — Exit the program with status. ### Description `EXIT` causes immediate termination of the program with status. If status is omitted it returns the canonical success for the system. All Fortran I/O units are closed. ### Syntax `CALL EXIT([STATUS])` ### Arguments of the default kind. ### Return value `STATUS` is passed to the parent process on exit. ### Example ``` program test_exit   integer :: STATUS = 0   print *, 'This program is going to exit.'   call EXIT(STATUS) end program test_exit ``` ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Subroutine ### See also ABORT, KILL
